arly the size of a human in his robot mode.

 some note, some piece of knowledge that

 perhaps even make a difference."

IE. "I can't pretend to know all

ritician.

HEELIE, "I don't want to
> face a future like that." He clapped WHEELIE on =
the shoulder in a
> friendly gesture, "But if you could, what kind of messa=

<NEW>

There was a quiet pause over from Wheel=
ie as he tried to think of something, something meaningful but also short a=
nd to the point.

"A difference..  They made.  That seems right, to comfort=
, we gave.  That's as much as we can say..  To let them know things shall b=
e right someday.  Without giving all away.  I think they would appreciate i=
t most in their own way."

Looking over the bays of the Ark, "So many of th=
em, end up dead.  Blasted apart, in the head.  Sparks destroyed, ripped abo=
ut, tossed into darkness and space and out.  Is that how we all end up some=
day?  Caught up in nohtingness and all away?"

He shrugs, "the future is al=
ready too far gone, how can we say what we do shall go on?"

Glancing over =
at the direction where Megatron would lie, someday, "We already know his ga=
me.  To change the past and remake his name.  How can we say that anything =
is ever doen?  When the future can be unmade, the lost war rewon?  When he =
can just send something else to the past?  Explaining how he unmade his cha=
nce?  Is that not what Megatron might do?  Try and unmake the past to make =
his future true?"
